title: Latest updates: Nottinghamshire Live on Wednesday 22 March 2017 - BBC News
summary: nottingham school 'worst hit ' in funding shake-up .
council energy company announces 17 % price rise .
people forced to spend night away from fire-hit block .
campaigners 'disappointed ' after drilling plan given go-ahead .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from local live .
join us again tomorrow .

documents.title: east midlands weather update : a mostly cloudy night with showers
text: tonight will be mostly cloudy with outbreaks of showery rain at times .
the winds will ease in strength in the early hours , with the chance of a few patches of mist and fog forming .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: your photos : squirrel in east leake
text: that is one determined squirrel hope he was n't driven nuts .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: police appeal after serious assault in new basford
text: nottinghamshire police has appealed for witnesses after a serious assault on a man in new basford .
the force said the assault occurred in maud street at about 23:10 on monday .
the victim sustained serious but not life-threatening injuries .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: parliament shooting : john mcdonnell mp nottingham lecture cancelled
text: following the tragic events in westminster this afternoon , the following lecture has been cancelled
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: residents allowed back into fire-hit apartment block
text: residents have been allowed back into their homes - and while for the most part they 're in remarkably good shape , some have quite a bit of water damage .
i 've spoken to a number of people whose boilers have been temporarily condemned for safety reasons , so although most have light , they may not have heat .
fire and police investigators have been here today but so far there 's no word on what caused the fire .
the top two floors are still out of action , so for some it 'll be a second night away from home .
author: Kevin Stanley
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: trio jailed for arson attack at disused nightclub
text: three men have been jailed for an arson attack at a disused nightclub in sutton-in-ashfield , nottinghamshire police said .

ricky whitworth , 24 , formerly of penn street , sutton-in-ashfield , connor bowerman , 19 , formerly of welbeck street , sutton-in-ashfield , and robert short , 19 , formerly of welbeck street , sutton-in-ashfield , were sentenced at nottingham crown court yesterday having all been found guilty of arson reckless as to whether life was endangered .
the court heard that the trio had set fire to the first base bar in low street on september 7 , 2015 .
the building was extensively damaged and the occupants of an adjoining flat were evacuated .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: mp 'arrived to vote as attack happened '
text: broxtowe mp anna soubry has reported that orpington mp jo johnson , boris johnson 's brother , had arrived to vote as the attack on parliament happened .
jo johnson arrived to vote as the attack happened was taken off his bike and bundled into the security check point hut
thank goodness for the police & security .
you must all be so shocked .
glad you 're ok .
hope you are safe inside
glad all are safe
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: gedling mp 's 'tremendous shock ' at parliament shooting
text: we 've just spoken to gedling mp vernon coaker , who is locked in the chamber .
he was at parliament for a vote .
he said : `` there is a tremendous sense of shock but that it 's not just about us [ mps ] .
there 's also a shared concern for the family of the woman killed and those injured . ''
author: Lewis Scrimshaw
News editor, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: sherwood mp expresses gratitude to police and security
text: grateful to @ twitterid and security forces working to keep us all safe , my thoughts are with all those injured are their families

BBC News Online

documents.title: police officer 'stabbed at uk parliament '
text: a bit more on this developing story
a police officer has been stabbed in the houses of parliament in central london , commons leader david lidington has said .
he told mps the `` alleged assailant was shot by armed police '' following a `` serious '' incident .
staff inside parliament were told to stay inside their offices .
scotland yard said it was called to a firearms incident on westminster bridge amid reports of several people injured .
transport for london said westminster underground station has been shut at the request of the police .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: mp wants clarity on energy price rise
text: earlier we told you that nottingham city council 's robin hood energy company has announced a 17 % price rise .
now nottingham east mp chris leslie has said he wants more clarity on why the rise is happening .
the labour mp told bbc radio nottingham : `` i think it 's important that companies that put up their bills explain why that 's happening .
`` yes , there are wholesale prices and all those other things , but i think a bit of transparency would help . ''
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather : sleet and hail showers this afternoon
text: rain pushing in throughout the afternoon with some heavier downpours possible at times which could also involve sleet and hail .
highs of 8c ( 46f ) .

documents.title: former forest winger burke relishing german education
text: former nottingham forest winger oliver burke has said he loves `` getting better and better `` as he continues his football education at bundesliga rb leipzig .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: new hope for couple who claim pregnancy drug left daughter disabled
text: a woman whose daughter was born with a severe deformity after she took a controversial pregnancy test drug in the 1970s says she has been given fresh hope of `` justice '' .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: new plans to develop former american adventure theme park site
text: plans to develop the former american adventure theme park site , near ilkeston , are likely to go before councillors later this year .
the site closed in 2007 and has been empty ever since - despite a campaign to bring another theme park to the area .
amber valley borough council is expecting a planning application for a mix of up to 300 homes and retail space .
what are your memories of the theme park ? .
let me know .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: district council chief executive to leave for new post
text: mansfield district council chief executive bev smith will leave the authority in june to take up the chief executive role at north west leicestershire district council , it has been announced .
mrs smith had taken over as interim chief executive and then chief executive in 2015 .
she will leave after eight years of service .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: missing 10-year-old girl found
text: great news we 've just heard that the 10-year-old who went missing earlier has been found safe and well .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: missing girl , 10 , last seen leaving school grounds
text: a missing 10-year-old girl was last seen leaving school grounds in wollaton this morning , nottinghamshire police said .
the child left the grounds to collect her bike from her home and has not been seen since .
she is described as white , 5ft 2ins tall , of medium build with long brown hair .
she was wearing a red top and grey bottoms .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'fewer carriages ' on some east midlands trains services
text: worth casting your eye over this if you are travelling later
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: demolition of office block near county hall nearing completion
text: speaking of all things nottinghamshire county council
work to demolish an office block next to county hall is nearing completion .
the council is considering what do do with the land next - but says the move will save almost £ 180,000 a year in running costs .
this is how it looked before demolition began
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: campaigners 'disappointed ' after drilling plan given council go-ahead
text: nottinghamshire county council has given plans for exploratory shale gas drilling in north nottinghamshire the go-ahead , subject to a legal agreement and 52 conditions .
dart energy plans to drill on land off the a634 between barnby moor and blyth in bassetlaw .
the application does n't include any proposals to undertake fracking .
protesters , including anti-fracking group frack free notts , gathered outside county hall ahead of yesterday 's meeting .
chris crean , midland campaigner for friends of the earth , called the council decision `` disappointing '' .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: people forced to spend night away from fire-hit block
text: in case you somehow missed this yesterday
about 20 people were forced to spend the night away from this apartment block in raleigh square after a major fire .

engineers from metropolitan housing , which owns the building , are working to reconnect electricity and gas supplies - but residents have been warned there 's been significant water damage following the huge firefighting operation , which involved seven fire engines and about 30 firefighters .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: council energy company announces 17 % price rise
text: nottingham city council 's robin hood energy company has announced a 17 % price rise for some of its customers .
the authority has blamed the price hike for its evergreen tariff on wholesale energy prices .
the measure could add £ 140 to the average household annual bill .
radio nottingham contacted councillor alan clark , the councillor responsible for overseeing robin hood energy , and councillors steve battlemuch and jon collins , who are on the board .
they also spoke to one of the council officers who oversees robin hood energy .
however , none of them were available to talk to them about the price rise .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: old education funding system 'unfair '
text: areas such as derby , however , can expect to see the total funding shared by schools to rise by about 2.4 % .

across england as a whole , rural areas will see an increase in funding because of a new `` sparsity '' measure that takes account of their schools being smaller and further away for pupils to travel to .
the department for education ( dfe ) is trying to end what it refers to as an `` historic postcode lottery in funding '' .
education secretary justine greening ( below ) says the old system is `` unfair '' as similar schools can get different levels of funding with `` little or no justification '' .
author: Daniel Wainwright
Data unit - English regions

documents.title: education cuts mean nottingham 'will have to reduce services '
text: head teachers representing about 3,000 schools .
say the new national funding formula ignores inflationary cost pressures faced by all schools .
meanwhile , nottingham city council said the changes will mean cuts to school services .

it 's the added enrichment - the out of normal hours services , the holiday clubs , the breakfast clubs , the trips to broaden the horizons of our children , the reading sessions for parents , the extra-curricular sports , culture and arts activities - that i fear will be first to go . ''
author: Daniel Wainwright
Data unit - English regions

documents.title: nottingham school 'worst hit ' in funding shake-up
text: nottingham will become one of the worst hit cities in the country in the first year of the biggest shake-up of school funding in england for decades , it has been revealed .
official figures released as part of the consultation on the changes show that nationally , 9,045 schools will lose money while 10,653 will get more .
in nottingham , 87 out of 89 schools will see either a cut or no increase in their funding .
that includes nottingham academy , which will get £ 224,000 less in the first year of the new `` funding formula '' .
author: Daniel Wainwright
Data unit - English regions

it 's me making a rare guest appearance on your nottinghamshire live page today with all your news , sport , travel and weather .
to paraphrase the good folks at plusnet , i 'll do you proud .
if you want to get in touch , you can do so via email , .
